title: Julia Fox defends controversial Jackie O. Halloween costume
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Julia Fox wore a bloodied Jackie Kennedy costume as a 'statement' for a Halloween party hosted by Julio Torres.
Jack Schlossberg criticized Fox's outfit, calling it 'disgusting, desperate, and dangerous' on social media.
Fox explained the costume symbolized Jackie Kennedy's bravery and highlighted the contrast of beauty and horror.

title: Falcons QB Michael Penix Jr., WR Drake London set to play vs. Patriots
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Falcons QB Michael Penix Jr. and WR Drake London to play against Patriots after missing Week 8 with injuries.
London is ranked sixth among NFL wide receivers this season, with 38 catches and 78.2 average yards per game.
Patriots CB Christian Gonzalez, allowing no touchdowns in 478 snaps, will face London in Week 9 matchup.

title: Craig Breslow believes Red Sox are in ‘improved position’ to get ‘right players’ this offseason
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Craig Breslow believes the Red Sox are better positioned to acquire desired players for the 2025 offseason.
Red Sox face roster challenges as Alex Bregman opts out, creating potential gaps in third base and pitching rotation.
The team remains $25 million under the luxury tax threshold with significant farm system prospects available for trades.

title: Mike Vrabel says recent Patriots changes have nothing to do with wanting to separate from the past
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Mike Vrabel has implemented changes to Patriots traditions, including individual introductions, moving away from past norms.
Vrabel clarified recent updates are not aimed at separating from the legacy but are focused on winning games.
The Patriots currently lead the AFC East with a 6-2 record under Vrabel's new leadership approach.

title: Bruins’ Elias Lindholm will miss ‘a few weeks’, Khusnutdinov promoted to 1C
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Elias Lindholm to miss a few weeks due to a lower-body injury sustained against the Sabres.
Bruins head coach Marco Sturm confirmed Lindholm will undergo an MRI to assess the injury's severity.
Marat Khusnutdinov promoted to top-line center, joining David Pastrnak and Morgan Geekie on the first line.

title: Photos: The best moments from Salem on Halloween 2025
author: Kelly Chan
bullets: Tourists and locals in costumes flocked to Salem, Massachusetts, for Halloween, participating in street performances and visiting haunted venues.
Visitors gathered on Essex Street to capture the Halloween spirit, joining events like the Witches' Circle at Salem Common.
Crowds visited the Salem Witch Trials Memorial, placing flowers and taking photos at various historic and themed attractions.

title: Moulton, without proof, accuses Trump of abusing girls with Epstein in tense TV interview
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Rep. Seth Moulton accused Donald Trump of abusing girls with Jeffrey Epstein without providing evidence, during an MSNBC interview.
Moulton, running against Sen. Ed Markey in 2026, linked Trump to crime and corruption as a political strategy.
MSNBC host Joe Scarborough challenged Moulton on his claims, noting the lack of evidence supporting accusations against Trump.

title: Brian Walshe’s next court appearance scheduled as cellphone evidence remains accessible
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Brian Walshe's trial in Norfolk Superior Court scheduled to begin jury selection on November 18.
Judge ordered preservation of evidence from former State Police Trooper Michael Proctor's cellphone for Walshe's defense.
Cellphone evidence relates to multiple Norfolk County cases, with defense attorneys allowed non-public copies for review.

title: Star Market over the Mass. Pike reopens after asbestos scare
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Star Market on Massachusetts Turnpike reopened after a three-day closure due to an asbestos scare.
Newton Health and Human Services Department closed the store after demolition work potentially released asbestos.
MassDEP confirmed the asbestos was contained; air and surface samples showed no asbestos presence in the store.

title: ‘He has everything to score 50’: Morgan Geekie is evolving into an elite goal scorer for Bruins
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Morgan Geekie is on pace for 57 goals this season, with nine goals in 13 games.
David Pastrnak praises Geekie's shot as the best among the Bruins, highlighting his goal-scoring potential.
Geekie's six-game goal streak makes him the sixth Bruins player with multiple streaks of at least six games.
